author: Deleted User
content:
Apparently Ethermine stopped including Tornado transactions since a week.
https://pbs.twimg.com/media/FafvpOWXkAA-6ue?format=jpg&name=medium

author: chris2_2_2
content: Damn so thatâ€™s the first example of eth censoring an entity I think?

author: chris2_2_2
content: Iâ€™ve always said the next step of mev is for exchanges to pay to block competitors and for entities on eth to pay protection fees and it looks like this is the first step towards that.

author: gwintery
content: Interesting to see how ethermine hashrate changes with this then. Does miners have the same censorship ethos as the protocol? Or do they not care?

author: darius510
content: Given the circumstances of mining ending in a month or so, even if they did care, I don't think they'd bother switching pools so close to the end, that creates another problem of potentially not mining enough on another pool to hit the payout threshhold pre-merge.

author: darius510
content: That being said, if I still had hashrate and eth wasn't on the verge of censoring PoW itself, I'd be off them ASAP, but it'd prob take me longer to actually search for a non-censoring pool than to actually switch the hashrate.

author: darius510
content: But that also being said, I would wager the vast majority of small individual miners don't know or care, and would stick with ethermine as they're basically the mining pool equivalent of coinbase.

author: treyzania
content: what do you mean "censoring PoW itself"?

author: darius510
content: It's still a sign of things to come though. If Bitfly isn't including tornado txs on ethermine, safe to assume they won't on their ethpool staking service either right out of the gate.

author: darius510
content: Oh come on, you know exactly what I mean. I'd just being cheeky.

author: treyzania
content: I do not know what you mean

author: darius510
content: Don't think too hard about it.

author: darius510
content: I wonder if binance pool is including them? As far as I'm aware that's the only other company that is currently doing both mining and staking pools.

author: darius510
content: actually i think there's also f2pool/stakefish

author: darius510
content: looks like f2pool is still including them

author: acid0003
content: Does anything say that pools must include the most profitable transactions in their blocks? It would only be censored if they started to uncle other pool's blocks for including these transactions.
